alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Lewis and Clark; Teton (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 7:35PM MDT until June 08 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN CASCADE, SOUTH CENTRAL TETON AND CENTRAL LEWIS AND CLARK COUNTIES... At 735 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges continued to indicate thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Rainfall rates are expected to be between 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Cascade, South Central Teton and Central Lewis and Clark Counties FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
